planet.name: HR 8799 c
HD 218396 c
planet.description: HR 8799 is a young Lambda Boötis star in the constellation of Pegasus. It hosts a debris disk and at least 4 planets. The outer two planets have peculiar spectral energy distributions that match a blend of L and T-type spectra.
planet.imagedescription: This image shows three planets orbiting the star HR 8799. It was obtained with the Keck II telescope on Hawaii. Credit: C. Marois et al., NRC Canada.
